function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Overlooking connectivity between spaces due to building design can contribute to air-based and surface-based transfer of pathogens.","Impact":"Increased risk of transmission within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive assessment of ventilation systems, doors, shared spaces, layout, and furniture to understand and mitigate transmission risks.","Technologies":"Advanced ventilation systems, air purifiers, antimicrobial surfaces, and spatial design tools.","People":"Occupants of buildings, building designers, architects, and public health officials.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for individual and social behaviors in epidemic models and design decisions may lead to ineffective control measures.","Impact":"Inaccurate modeling of disease transmission and ineffective control efforts.","Mitigation":"Incorporate variations in individual and social behaviors into epidemic models and design decision-making processes. Educate and encourage positive health behaviors.","Technologies":"Behavioral modeling software, data analytics for behavior patterns, and educational tools for promoting healthy behaviors.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, building designers, and individuals in the community.","Owner":"Public health agencies, building owners, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Insufficient understanding of the influence of behavior on the spread of COVID-19 may hinder control efforts and re-opening strategies.","Impact":"Uncertainty and ineffectiveness in controlling COVID-19 transmission, leading to potential outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Conduct research and studies to better understand the influence of behavior on disease spread. Develop targeted policies and communication strategies to influence positive behavior change.","Technologies":"Surveillance and tracking tools, behavioral research methods, and communication platforms for public health education.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, policymakers, and the general public.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, and government bodies."}]}
